For some reason, Quora has merged two questions together, which means my answer below doesn’t make sense I answered the question; “Can you overcome depression completely?” Cheers, Allan I am in my mid-50s now and in the past, I suffered with depression since I was 16 or 17 years old It’s only been in the last five or six years that I can confidently say; “Yes, it is possible you can overcome your depression completely” But that does not mean there is a quick and easy fix for you, because that is rarely the case This is what I have learnt from my more than 20 years of battling with the black dog of depression and finally overcoming it Overcoming your depression could be an up-and-down journey over some time, where you will fluctuate from feeling hopeful and optimistic to falling into despair like there is no hope You may have periods of relief, even for several years, but then your depression could come back to haunt you and you need medical treatment once again A fully qualified mental health nurse told me once, that she sees many people seek treatment, get better to some degree, get on with their lives and return every few years for more treatment There is no shame in needing medical help for your depression, I did many times and I’m glad I spoke up when I did (even though the medications did very little for me) If you want to heal completely, you have to be prepared to try everything! You also have to be determined to never give up, no matter how hopeless your treatment seems to be going at any point in your journey to recovery Here is the one most important thing that was taught to me about all human life, even the bible talks about this “My people perish for lack of a vision” You have to be determined to never give up and have a vision of what you want your life to look like, once you have healed Think about that for a minute! If a genie came out of the lamp and granted you complete health and happiness, what would you want to do with your life from now on? What would you do, beyond anything else, that would inspire you, uplift you, energise you and leave you feeling fulfilled and satisfied? These are the positive life enhancing and healing energies you will need to completely heal from your depression The positive energies of; optimism, feeling uplifted and inspired, feeling satisfied and fulfilled, and being able to freely express yourself in many ways From my experience, there was one glaring problem with the medical and therapeutic treatment of depression And it’s a problem that permeates the whole of any civilised society! You are taught to focus on your faults! You end up constantly focusing on what you do wrong in life and your past mistakes Then, that negative voice in your head poisons you from the inside, with nasty self-critical thoughts, that you end up believing to be true This leads you to compare yourself to other people, which can only make the problem worse, because that little negative voice in your head can then tell you; “You are worthless and no good to anyone” This can amplify your faults and shortcomings even more in your own mind and lead to feelings of hopelessness and despair, because you believe that is who you are and nothing is ever going to change The one secret to overcoming my depression completely, was to begin to focus on my natural talents and abilities and therefore what I was good at! This was the only way I began to feel the positive energies of optimism, fulfilment and satisfaction Only then did I begin to truly believe in myself and have a whole new vision of living a happy and contented life, where I would use my natural talents and abilities to help my fellow man Up until then, I was stuck in a boring, uninteresting and unfulfilling job that society and my family taught me was what I was supposed to do “You made your bed, now you have to lye in it” I firmly believe that depression is at least in part, depression of your natural energy and your natural self-expression Without discovering what your natural talents and abilities are and expressing them and living through them in your everyday life, so you can enjoy energetic feelings of satisfaction and fulfilment, it would be difficult to get rid of your depression completely I spent 30 years working in the electrical trade and it took me 25 of those years to admit to myself; I absolutely hated it with a passion No wonder I couldn’t overcome my depression! Hating who I was and what I was doing for a living, was like an anchor around my neck dragging me down into constant despair But that was what society and my family had taught me; “whatever you choose when you leave school, that is who you are” No wonder I was always miserable, irritable, angry and bored being stuck as a round peg in a square hole I was never going to be happy doing something that didn’t resonate with my natural talents and abilities You see, as a child, I was squashed, and not listened to, I felt unloved and utterly rejected, over and over again Growing up in a cold and loveless environment, meant I was never allowed to express myself and grow into a happy person, who became naturally more alive, self confident and full of energy I never discovered who I really was and what I truly wanted to do with my life I was stuck in survival mode, hoping I could just get through one more day and wake up to the next one Once I started to focus on my strengths and talents, I began to open up to much more energy and clarity of thought I began to have more hope and optimism for a brighter future and I became much more motivated to achieve what I really wanted in life I began to believe in myself more! I had a brand-new vision for a brand-new future and I got rid of that stupid old saying that you hear so often; “Once you hit 40, it’s all downhill from there” What a load of rubbish! Anybody can reinvent themselves at any time in their life and I am living proof of that Don’t let negative people tell you things like; “You will be stuck where you are forever, you’ll never achieve anything” It’s simply not true! Of course, you must listen to your qualified health professional and treat your depression in a sensible way You need a correct diagnosis from your doctor and possibly, medical and therapeutic help along your journey Exercising and eating a healthy diet are also vital, as is being tested for any possible underlying health conditions that may be causing your depression symptoms You also want to avoid drugs and alcohol as much as you can, if you truly want to heal and live your best life possible Once you seek the right medical help though, my advice to you is this; don’t stop there! Discover what type of work and lifestyle would deeply resonate with you and work on putting the steps in place to achieve that goal Don’t live in a miserable way like I did, literally for decades Don’t be a round peg in a square hole for the rest of your life From my research and understanding; the happiest and most fulfilled people in the world are living from a purpose that gives them great satisfaction and meaning in their life This is what I now believe; you must heal your depression at a medical level, a psychological level, a biological level and a spiritual level And it’s not as hard as you might think The medical level may take care of any chemical imbalances in your brain, to give you relief from pain and suffering The psychological level may take care of your faulty and negative thinking, limiting beliefs and lack of resilience in dealing with your life problems The biological level is healing and taking care of your physical body, so you can release more energy to help you feel full of beans, more positive and optimistic and therefore to help you heal The spiritual level, is discovering how to live in sync with your natural self and all of the hidden talents and abilities you have deep inside yourself You were born with these! Who you truly are has never been nurtured into your adult life because of an unhappy and less than ideal childhood But you must be determined, dedicated and develop an inner strength to keep going and be guided through the dark times to uncover who you really are at your very core You have so much untapped inner strength, resilience and potential, it would amaze and shock you, in a positive way, what you are truly capable of in this life Do not listen to or believe anyone who puts you down in any way and find positive people who will up lift you and encourage you to become all you can be

Today, I run a very successful 7-figure coaching company, am in incredible health, in the relationship of my dreams, and surrounded by people that I love. … But it wasn’t always this way. Only a few short years ago, I was severely depressed. Even after achieving all of my big goals, building a profitable business, and becoming a social powerhouse… I still felt empty inside. … I remember years ago I would drive to work and consider driving myself off the Coronado bridge into the ocean. It seemed like an easier decision than living another day feeling the way that I did. … Thankfully I didn’t. I decided to make a change. I decided that I was going to overcome depression once and for all WITHOUT drugs or decades of therapy. And boy am I glad that I did. While I’ve written a comprehensive guide to depression where I detail my battle and the tactics that I used to overcome my demons, I’m going to give you the cliff notes version in this response. By taking action on the tactics and mindsets I’m about to share with you, you’ll be able to beat depression permanently and naturally… Let’s dive in  First… Accept that Depression and Happiness are a Choice “What?”, I can already hear you saying, “Who the hell do you think you are? I don’t WANT to be depressed!” But before you go getting too angry… Let me explain. I agree, that depression, by and large, is not always a choice. Sure, there are some people who simply enjoy the attention and the pandering they get from being “depressed” but I’m going to assume you aren’t one of them. But based on your question, I’m going to assume that you, like me, have genuine clinical depression and want to know how to get out of it. So how in the world is it a choice? Think about it this way… When you were born, you weren’t born depressed. Hell, you didn’t even know what depression was! But as you got older and started to learn and adopt the behaviors from people around you something changed. … You learned how to envy other’s posessions, how to mistreat yourself, and how to throw one person pity party’s anytime that something didn’t go your way. And somewhere along the way… You forgot how to be happy. There are two main types of depression Physical depression caused by a neurological imbalance (which is rarer than you might imagine)Conditioned depression caused by lack of perspective, an unhealthy lifestyle, and negative childhood conditioningBoth are beatable… … And in fact, both require the same strategies to overcome. But this strategy starts with a decision. You must decide RIGHT NOW whether you will let depression beat you and define you or whether you will overcome it once and for all. I’m not saying that you can just flip a switch in your brain and all of the sudden break out of your depression and experience happiness. But I AM saying that you have to choose whether or not you will stay depressed. When I was at my lowest point in life on the verge of suicide, I had a decision to make. I could either cave into the mental pressure or I could rise up and beat it. I chose option #2. … Nothing changed overnight. It took me nearly two years of hard work and constant reconditioning before I completely eradicated my depression. But it was still a choice. I could have chosen to accept depression as a part of life. But I didn’t. And right now, you have the same decision to make. Depression might be a part of your life but it’s not who you are. So what will you decide. Will you let this disease beat you, cripple you, and devastate your quality of life. Or will you wrestle it to the ground and beat this son of a b****h once and for all? The choice is yours. 7 Quick and Dirty Tactics I Used to Beat My Depression and Find Happiness in an Unhappy World Now that you understand why and how depression is a choice, it’s time to dive into the nitty gritty tactics that will help you beat it. The following tactics are backed by mountains of clinical research and if you’re interested in reading about the studies or learning more about why they work then I recommend checking out my guide to depression. Now enough small talk! … Let’s dive in! Tactic #1: Get Plenty of Good Quality Sleep One of the leading causes of depression is sleep deprivation. Sleeplessness has been linked to a plethora of medical conditions and it costs the US more billions of dollars in lost productivity and healthcare each year.  If you want to beat your depression, then start by fixing your sleep. Set a scheduled bedtime and wake up timeGo to bed before midnight if possibleSleep in a cold pitch black roomDrink chamomile tea with 1 Tbsp of Honey and 1 Tbsp of Apple Cider vinegar an hour before bedSupplement with magnesium (1,000 mg), L-theanine (100 mg), and 5-HTP (200 mg - 500 mg)Don’t eat after 9 p.m.Turn off all electronics 60 minutes before bed and instead read, journal, play an instrument, and relaxIf you will take action on these simple steps I promise you can start feeling a difference in your mental state as soon as tomorrow. Sleep plays a huge role in regulating our moods and disposition for depression. Fix your sleep and you will begin to fix your life. Tactic #2: Sweat for 30 Minutes a Day Exercise is one of nature’s miracle drugs  Here are just a few of the benefits you can derive from a regular exercise program Benefits including: Elevated mood, reduced stress, and less anxietyImproved blood flow to the brainThe production of new brain cellsImproves memoryImproved discipline, impulse control, and decision makingAnd, most importantly, decreased depression.You don’t have to kill yourself at the gym to reap these benefits either. … Only 20–30 minutes of exercise a day has been shown to increase mood, decrease depression, and help ensure that your body is firing on all cylinders. I found that the more frequently I exercised the harder it was to feel depressed and now… It’s a habit that you couldn’t take away from me at gunpoint. Pick a fun activity that will get you off your butt and break a sweat. Do it for 30 minutes a day and I promise you will feel a difference. Tactic #3: Let Food Be Thine Medicine Studies have shown that altering your diet can be more effective at treating clinical depression than traditional SSRIs. Most of us don’t realize this but the majority of the foods we consume as a part of the Standard American Diet are completely devoid of any nutritional value.  … This means that we are all walking around with severe nutrient imbalances we aren’t even aware of! In order to fix these imbalances it’s important that you eat a varied diet filled with all sorts of different vegetables, fruits, and meats. Here are a few general recommendations to get you started Encouraged foods: whole grains, fruits, vegetables, legumes, low-fat/ unsweetened dairy, raw unsalted nuts, lean red meat, chicken, fish, eggs, and olive oilDiscouraged foods: sweets, refined cereals, fried food, fast food, processed meat, soft drinks.Beverages: maximum two sugar-sweetened beverages per week and maximum two alcoholic drinks per day, preferably red wine with the occasional screw-upI found that when I threw out the processed foods, cut out sugar, and started eating 10X more fresh fruits and vegetables my mood improved considerably. In conjunction with sleep and exercise this is one of the best ways I’ve found to cure depression and lead an amazing life. Tactic #4: Double Down on Your Social Life Living in a state of isolation can be as bad for your health as smoking 15 cigarettes a day! This might sound crazy… But it’s true. We humans evolved to be social creatures.  Our hunter gatherer ancestors lived, worked, played, and did life as a tribe. It wasn’t just a matter of having a good time for them. … It was a matter of survival. Your brain is hardwired to crave social interaction. As such, one of the BEST things you can do to cure your depression is to tap the brakes on all the overtime and instead double down on spending time with friends and family. Tactic #5: Practice Gratitude Daily One of the common causes of depression is simply lack of perspective. We live in an increasingly narcissistic society that almost forces you to focus on yourself and all of your problems. At every turn you’re told you are not good enough.  Advertisements and social media tell you that you need: The latest carBetter clothesA nicer smelling cologneThe hot girl or guyBigger muscles or a better buttAnd a whole slew of other things. But the truth is… You are enough right now You have everything you need to beat depression and feel happy You just have to realize it. This starts by expressing gratitude daily by writing down and focusing on everything that is going well in your life. If you can’t think of anything going well, then express gratitude that you made it through another day. You have a lot to be grateful for… A roof over your head, clothes on your back, breath in your lungs. That’s all you need to be happy. But you must first accept this then express it. Tactic #6: Meditate Like a Monk Extensive research has been conducted that have shown some pretty amazing and surprising findings regarding the effects of meditation. Increases the production of neurotransmitters like serotoninShrinks the brain’s fear centerDeactivates the anxiety and depression centers of the brainRebuilds the hippocampus of the brainStimulates the same Alpha and Theta brain waves Doctors use to combat depressionAnd that’s just the tip of the iceberg.  Meditation is proven to help: (source) Lower blood pressureAlleviate symptoms of insomniaReduce depression and anxietyReduce painReduce symptoms of IBSAid in smoking cessationTaking up a meditation practice for even 10 minutes a day can have profound and far reaching affects on your life. It helped me cure my depression and I can guarantee it will help you too. Tactic #7: Laugh Like Your Life Depends on It When you are depressed, it can feel hard to laugh. … Which is exactly why you need to laugh MORE  According to HealthCentral there are a number of scientifically validated reasons to laugh more… Strengthen the immune system by activating cells that attack viruses.Lower blood pressure for some by inducing relaxation and preventing the release of stress hormones such as cortisol.Trigger the release of endorphins which give you a sense of well being. These endorphins are also natural painkillers.Reduce stress and anxiety because it naturally relaxes you. Laughter induces your heart rate to slow down and your blood pressure to decrease.Increases our creativity as it encourages a new perspective to look at things.Improves our mood through social connection and an increased feeling of belonging. Laughing with friends can decrease feelings of alienation and lowers our risk for depression.Act like laughter is your new job. Binge watch funny shows on Netflix, go to comedy clubs, watch standups during your down time, and spend time around funny people. Life is short. … So laugh dammit! Conclusion Depression is not easy to beat. It will require effort and commitment. …But it is possible. By taking action on the above tactics and CHOOSING to live in a beautiful state, you can beat depression once and for all. If I can do it… So can you. We’re all rooting for you Stay Grounded, Andrew

You overcome by realizing that nobody is going to rescue you. In the very depths of my episodes I used to sit and wait for someone, anyone, that stranger, this friend, that bus driver, this girl, that professor, this dog, anyone, anything—-to reach their arms down into my psychological pit and pull me out as I slept in peace. While that may be a very religiously affirming idea, the bare truth lies in the fact that this ‘X-factor’, this unquantifiable energy we call God, is the very figment of OUR being. Only YOU can save YOU. Therefore God saves you. Understand? In my experience, the best way to overcome depression and anxiety is a mental and emotional exercise. Every time I had a negative thought or emotion, I immediately replaced it with a good one. Replaced rejection with the image of a puppy. Replaced homesickness with the thought of chocolate cake. Completely disproportionate right? Correct. It felt like crap because the good emotion does not adequately superimpose the boundaries of the negativity. But, what it DOES do, is BREED. Let’s get into some mathematics of emotion here: 1 happy thought amplifies in 10x intensity in 2 hours. Then, 1 negative thought amplifies in 100x intensity in 1 hour. Can you see why this is an uphill battle now? Happiness is an underdog. Now, if I add an excess of happiness, enough to render the rate of negative thought propagation null and void, I would have washed out the sadness. It is chemistry of feeling. Here are some of the best things you can do to reduce (and even completely eliminate) chronic depression and anxiety from your life. These are not quick fixes; they may take a few weeks to fully take effect. But they worked for me and they are backed by research—I’ve been free of chronic depression and anxiety since 2010 based on these strategies, which I call the sudist method: Significantly reduce your use of commonplace and recreational drugs, including marijuana, alcohol, and nicotine (both cigarettes and vapes), whichever apply. Even if these help you cope in the short term, they virtually always make depression and anxiety much worse in the long run.Gradually increase the amount of natural physical activity you do 	each day. Walking, jogging, dancing, biking, sports and swimming all fit the bill. Start small if you have low energy, like a short walk every day. If you are too anxious to leave the house, you can do burpees or jumping jacks, which require no equipment and almost no space and will get you feeling the burn in no time. Do a little 	every day, and gradually increase the amount each day. Even if you don’t feel like it, kick yourself in the butt and do it. Find 	someone who can be active with you and help you stay motivated.Accept your physical and emotional aches and pains instead of 	trying to suppress them or self-medicate them. Avoid painkillers. Wean off of mood stabilizer drugs (like antidepressants), but ONLY under the guidance of a qualified physician. Meditate and be mindful. Embrace suffering and listen to its message, for pain is an integral part of life and is ultimately unavoidable. We may succeed briefly in numbing it or pushing it away but then it always returns with a vengeance.Cut back on fast-paced, mindless stimulation, including video games, TV, movies, mindless social media, music, etc. Do calm activities instead such as chatting with friends, going for nature walks, playing with children and pets, meditating, school work, arts/crafts, chores, etc.Significantly reduce your consumption of sweetened or savourized 	foods and beverages. Instead, eat whole unprocessed foods with no added savourizers (i.e. salt/sodium or MSG) and no added sweeteners (i.e. real sugar or any of the alternatives like aspartame, splenda or even stevia). Drink water or milk instead of juice, pop, or shakes. Most people do not realize how huge of an impact food has on mood, including chronic anxiety and depression. The best way to avoid these is to read the ingredients lists of everything you consume. Yes, food will taste bland at first (that’s how food is supposed to taste!), but you will get used to it in time, like I did.You don’t have to do all of these at once, but you have to start somewhere. Once you apply some of these principles, it may take a few weeks to see your depression and anxiety start to lift and the transition period may be challenging (fatigue, weakness, flu-like symptoms, etc, all entirely normal), but if you push through it, these symptoms eventually go away and you will find that your depression or anxiety have gone down significantly, or have even been completely eliminated.
